statement: A 2-meter long steel rod with a cross-sectional area of $400\text{ mm}^2$ is subjected to an axial tensile load of $80\text{ kN}$. If $E = 200\text{ GPa}$, calculate the total elongation $\delta$.

An aluminum bar is constrained between two rigid walls. If the temperature increases by $50^\circ\text{C}$, calculate the magnitude of the thermal stress $\sigma$ induced. ($E = 70\text{ GPa}$, $\alpha = 23 \times 10^{-6}/^\circ\text{C}$)
A 10-mm diameter titanium specimen is pulled in tension. The axial strain is $0.002$. If $\nu = 0.33$, calculate the absolute change in diameter $|\Delta d|$.

A shelf is being designed to hold crates having a total mass of $1840\text{ kg}$. Two circular support rods hold the shelf. Assume that the center of gravity of the crates is at the middle of the shelf. Specify the required diameter $d$ of the circular rods to limit the stress to $110\text{ MPa}$.

Specify a suitable aluminum alloy for the member $AB$ in the provided assembly (square $20\text{ mm}$ cross-section) if the $12.5\text{ kN}$ load is to be repeated many times. Consider only the square part near the middle of the member.

Figure P3–64 shows two bars of different materials separated by $0.50\text{ mm}$ when the temperature is $20^\circ\text{C}$. At what temperature $T$ would they touch? (AISI 430 Stainless steel: $L=2.8\text{ m}, \alpha=10.4 \times 10^{-6}/^\circ\text{C}$; Brass: $L=1.9\text{ m}, \alpha=20.5 \times 10^{-6}/^\circ\text{C}$)

category: Torsional Shear Stress and Torsional Deformation
statement: Figure P4-9 shows the end of the vertical shaft for a rotary lawn mower. Compute the maximum torsional shear stress in the shaft if it is transmitting $7.5\text{ hp}$ to the blade when rotating at $2200\text{ rpm}$. Specify a suitable steel for the shaft.

category: Torsional Shear Stress and Torsional Deformation
statement: Figure P4-10 shows a stepped shaft in torsion. The larger section also has a hole drilled through. Compute the maximum shear stress at the step for an applied torque of $7500\text{ lb·in}$.

category: Torsional Shear Stress and Torsional Deformation
statement: Compute the angle of twist of the free end relative to the fixed end of the steel bar shown in Figure P4-27. Use $G=80\text{ GPa}$.

hw_subtitle: Shearing Forces and Bending Moments in Beams
category: Shearing Forces and Bending Moments in Beams
statement: A $4\text{-m}$ long simply supported beam carries a concentrated load of $10\text{ kN}$ at its midspan. Determine the maximum bending moment $M_{max}$ occurring in the beam.
A rectangular beam ($b=100\text{ mm}, h=200\text{ mm}$) is subjected to a bending moment of $20\text{ kNm}$. Calculate the maximum bending stress $\sigma_{max}$ at the top fibers.

A rectangular beam section experiences a vertical shear force of $50\text{ kN}$. If the section dimensions are $b=80\text{ mm}$ and $h=150\text{ mm}$, find the maximum shear stress $\tau_{max}$ at the neutral axis.
A cantilever beam of length $L=3\text{ m}$ supports a point load $P=5\text{ kN}$ at its free end. If $EI = 2000\text{ kNm}^2$, calculate the maximum deflection $\delta_{max}$ at the tip.

A point in a structural member is subjected to a tensile stress $\sigma_x = 80\text{ MPa}$ and a shear stress $\tau_{xy} = 30\text{ MPa}$. Using Mohr's Circle, determine the maximum principal stress $\sigma_1$.
